experiences.title: Co-Chief Executive Officer
experiences.description:
• Co-founded the Diversity Café in middle school to raise awareness about obesity and to promote healthier eating habits among students and teachers.
• Gained full rights for feeding elementary students (288 students) for 3 consecutive years and middle/high school students (600 students) for all years of operation during recess and lunchtime.
• Got sponsored by Danone during all years of operation.
• Recruited, trained, and coordinated learning and development initiatives for 70+ employees (middle/high school graders) in the span of 4 years to help with running the café in all operations.
• Implemented a scheduling system for employees' daily bases tasks and working schedules.
• Led a team of 7 students in annual social events and fairs held in school to ensure an increase in the café’s profitability and ensure the consistency of our brand among students, faculty, and parents.
• An Estimate of E£ 80,000 in profits was made in the first year of operation and an Estimate of E£ 350,000 in profits was made in the last year of operation.
• All Profits went to school workers (20 custodians, 10 helping assistants, 15 bus matrons, and 15 bus drivers) and a kid’s orphanage by the end of each year.

name: James Kemerait
headline: CS @ Georgia Tech
about: My name is James Kemerait, and I am a 4th-year Computer Science student at the Georgia Institute of Technology. Born in rural Tifton, Georgia, I always set my sights on something bigger, following my passion for discovery to the Georgia Institute of Technology. My interests include data engineering, quantum computing, and HCI. My professional experiences include a data science/software engineering internship at Dell Technologies and an autonomous/robotics systems internship at Factor Automation Systems. On campus, I am currently a teaching assistant for CS 2050, Discrete Math, and have participated in research involving quantum materials optimization and machine learning, and data science to support nonprofit organizations.Thanks for checking out my profile! Can't wait to connect :)

name: Cece Liao
headline: Georgia Tech MSc Candidate in Computational Science & Engineering | Skilled in Python, MATLAB, SQL, & Data Visualization | Experienced in ML Algorithms & Geospatial Analysis
about: Driven by a passion for computational science and data analytics, I am thrilled to discover the fascinating world of technology, where each difficult problem can be cracked by decomposing it into easily digestible parts. My goal is to leverage my diverse education and experiences to innovate within the fields of analytics, financial analysis, and data analysis.Working in a variety of research and analysis roles has provided me with a ready-to-use toolkit for creating, scaling, and refining impactful business solutions.Throughout my academic and professional career, I have:-Pioneered machine learning and deep learning projects to solve real-world problems-Mastered a wide array of technical skills, including Python, MATLAB, SQL, and data visualization tools like Tableau and Power BI-Led teams that pushed the boundaries of what's possible in computational analysis and geospatial analyticsI am committed to:-Placing data-driven insights at the heart of every decision to ensure optimal outcomes.-Cultivating and leading teams that thrive on collaboration, innovation, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.-Embracing continuous learning and adapting swiftly to new technological advancements.I seek to:-Engage with like-minded professionals who are passionate about leveraging technology to drive business growth.-Contribute my skills and knowledge to projects and roles that make a tangible difference in the business landscape and beyond.Let's connect if you're interested in discussing computational science, data analytics, or simply exchanging insights on the latest in tech innovations.Professional Skills: Data Analysis | Statistical Modeling | Machine Learning | Project Management | Data Visualization | Market Research | Critical Thinking | Computational Problem SolvingDomain Knowledge: Civil Engineering | Geospatial Analysis | Health Tech | Job Market Analysis | Risk Management | Infrastructure Management

projects.description: Project involving 18+ undergraduate students, aimed at helping students at Georgia Tech develop biotechnology-centered research skills. The current goal is to devise a silk fibroin-based hydrogel that acts as an artificial and biocompatible cartilage implant. Our team has produced different meniscus implants utilizing varying lab techniques, and we have run compression and tensile tests weekly, in order to determine the strength and biocompatibility of our prototypes.

projects.project_name: BinVision: Computer Vision for Efficient Waste Classification
projects.description:
• Won a general track of Hack Georgia Tech (Sustainability Track) due to BinVision’s impact on sustainaiblity and recycling efforts
• Received the Micro Research Grants for Regenerative Built Environments to continue development
• Developed a ResNet34 that that outputs efficient, accurate classifications from a live camera feed - motion activated
• Created a full stack application with a React.js frontend and Node/Express.js/Firebase/Flask backend that hosts the model and provides statistical analysis on trash patterns across all trash sites

projects.project_name: Creating Robust Semantic Segmentation Models to Handle Adversarial Image-Based Autonomous Vehicle Attacks
projects.description: This project helps self-driving cars from malfunctioning if presented with an external cybersecurity attack with the help of adversarial training. I also propose a new model: ATNet, that increases the ability of the vehicle to locate the objects around in during the driving task.

projects.project_name: A Comparative Study of Deep Learning Models to Identify Tuberculosis and Pneumonia from Chest X-Rays
projects.description: Created and compared a DenseNet121, ResNet50, InceptionV3, InceptionResNetV2, and AlexNet for classifying Tuberculosis and Pneumonia (easily misdiagnosed diseases) from Chest X-Rays

Developing an app that serves as a central hub for the learning of JavaScript, C++, Python, Java, and R. This app gives people of all sorts of skill levels access to learning these popular programming languages.

name: Shyamanth Kudum
headline: SWE Intern @ Palantir | BS/MS Computer Science @ Georgia Tech
about: Motivated, curious computer science student at Georgia Institute of Technology. Passionate about developing projects and gaining experience in the fields of software engineering, cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and quantitative development.

projects.description: Implemented FCFS, Round-Robin, and Preemptive Priority with Aging algorithms for efficient CPU scheduling and process management.Developed thread-safe mechanisms using mutex locks and conditional variables to protect shared data structures, simulating a reliable multiprocessor environment.

Designed and managed a 20-bit byte addressable physical memory system, including address splitting, page table and frame table initialization, context switching, and memory access functions to translate virtual addresses to physical addresses.Created mechanisms for page fault handling, eviction, and replacement using FIFO and Clock Sweep algorithms, incorporating swap space management to handle evicted pages.

Developed a comprehensive LC-1001 datapath, incorporating subcircuits for modularity, including a custom Arithmetic Logic Unit and control unit.Added hardware support for interrupts, which includes the creation of an Interrupt Enable register and an external clock device, to enable preemptive multitasking.Implemented a microcontroller unit to manage control signals across the datapath, ensuring the seamless operation of the LC-1001 processor.

Developed secure login and registration features using Firebase Authentication, allowing cross-device user access and data management.Integrated Spotify API to display personalized Spotify Wrapped summaries, allowing users to explore their top tracks and artists, and developed interactive games tailored to their preferences.Managed user profiles with features for password reset, account deletion, and secure logout.

Pioneered the implementation of a seamless and intuitive navigation system, ensuring a smooth user journey through the application for both IOS and Android.Led the creation of a fitness catalog page, providing in-depth and comprehensive information on a wide range of exercises, effectively enhancing user engagement.Conducted thorough testing and debugging, identifying and resolving issues promptly, resulting in a more stable and reliable fitness app.
